org.freezedry.persistence.builders

Class AbstractNodeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.builders.AbstractNodeBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NodeBuilder, Copyable<NodeBuilder>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractLeafNodeBuilder, ArrayNodeBuilder, CollectionNodeBuilder, MapNodeBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractNodeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements NodeBuilder
    Abstract implementation of the NodeBuilder interface. Abstract class for the classes used to generate InfoNodes. These NodeBuilders are used by the PersistenceEngine to create InfoNode from Object and vice-versa. These NodeBuilders must fit in with the recursive method used by the PersistenceEngine.createNode(Class, Object, String) method. This class does two things:
    • Manages the reference to the PersistenceEngine
    • Provides a convenience method createNode(Class, Object, String) that simply calls the PersistenceEngine.createNode(Class, Object, String) method.
    See Also:
    NodeBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • getPersistenceEngine

        public PersistenceEngine getPersistenceEngine()
        Returns:
        The PersistenceEngine used by this NodeBuilder

      • setPersistenceEngine

        public void setPersistenceEngine(PersistenceEngine engine)
        Description copied from interface: NodeBuilder
        Sets the PersistenceEngine with which this NodeBuilder must work. Recall, that the NodeBuilder.createInfoNode(Class, Object, String) methods is called from within an recursive algorithm managed by the PersistenceEngine.createNode(Class, Object, String) method. The reference to the PersistenceEngine is used to call be to that method for creating non-leaf nodes (this essentially allows the recursion to continue).
        Specified by:
        setPersistenceEngine in interface NodeBuilder
        Parameters:
        engine - The PersistenceEngine used to create the DOM model from the object

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the interface-to-class mapping contains the specified interface; false otherwise

      • createNode

        protected InfoNode createNode(java.lang.Class<?> containingClass,
                  java.lang.Object object,
                  java.lang.String fieldName)
                       throws java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException
        Creates an InfoNode by calling back to PersistenceEngine.createNode(Class, Object, String). This allows the recursion to continue, and removes the responsibility of working through the object hierarchy from the implementation of node generator.
        Parameters:
        containingClass - The Class that contains the field of the specified name, and value
        object - The value of the field with the specified name
        fieldName - The name of the field
        Returns:
        An InfoNode representing the field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException

      • extractTypeInfo

        protected Pair<java.lang.Class<?>,java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Type>> extractTypeInfo(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Extracts the type information from the specified Type. Recall that the type could be a Class or a ParameterizedType. In the latter case, we must also extract the type information of the ParameterizedType, since it may also have generic parameters. And in either case, we must return the Class associated with the specified Type
        Parameters:
        type - The Type from which to get the Class and the parameterized information.
        Returns:
        the Class associated with the Type and any type information associated with the Type if it is an instance of the ParameterizedType

      • buildObject

        protected java.lang.Object buildObject(java.lang.Class<?> containingClass,
                           java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Type> types,
                           InfoNode node,
                           InfoNode parentNode)
                                throws java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException
        Builds the most specific object for the specified Class and InfoNode. For example, if the specified Class is Map and the InfoNode contains a Class LinkedHashMap, then it will create a LinkedHashMap. Also updates the node with any additional generic type information it will need for further processing.
        Parameters:
        containingClass - The class containing the field to instantiate.
        clazz - The specified Class to instantiate.
        types - The generic type information
        node - The InfoNode associated with the specified Class
        parentNode - The parent node to the specified InfoNode
        Returns:
        The newly created object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException

      • updateNode

        protected void updateNode(InfoNode node,
              java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Type> types,
              InfoNode parentNode)
        Updates the specified node with information that will be need for downstream processing. This is mostly needed when the Map contains other classes that have generic types. For example, when a Map< String, Map< String, Double > > is processed, then we supplement the node holding the Map< String, Double > with type information, the name of the outer Map's field, and any information about the type to instantiate based on the outer Map's annotations.
        Parameters:
        node - The InfoNode to supplement.
        types - The type information of the inner generic class
        parentNode - The parent to the specified InfoNode
